result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge

2:00 PM case called. Defendant Cheri J Donnelly in court.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Cheri J Donnelly. Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Afton Lewis in court. State calls Officer Larsen to testify- is sworn and testifies. 
Record to reflect identification of the defendant by Officer Larsen. Cross examination by the Defense. Re Direct by the State. Witness is released. State asks for bind over. Defense argues against bind over. 
Court binds matter to Branch 3 to schedule an ARGN.

Order on Request to Appear Remotely
The Court Orders: Officer Tyler Larsen may appear remotely for the proceeding scheduled on 10/18/2022 at 1:30 p.m.
Proposed Order on Request to Appear Remotely

10:08 AM case called. Defendant Cheri J Donnelly in court.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Cheri J Donnelly.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Conditions: 
No contact with K.S.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.

(11:32 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Cheri J Donnelly in court. Attorney George E. Miller in court for Cheri J Donnelly.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Attorney Miller moves to dismiss the complaint. Court denies the motion to dismiss.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on August 29, 2022 at 2:45 pm.
Hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions: 
No contact with K.S.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.

Attorney George Miller at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $35 beginning 08/26/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.
